summary: Master the fundamentals of Canva for web and mobile. Learn to navigate the interface, use core tools, and create your first designs.

lessons.title: Welcome to Canva
lessons.content:
What is Canva?

Canva is a powerful and user-friendly online design platform that makes it easy to create professional-looking graphics, presentations, social media posts, and more, without needing extensive design experience. It uses a drag-and-drop interface and provides a vast library of templates, fonts, and images.

Key Features:

  • Thousands of templates for various formats.
  • Huge library of stock photos, icons, and fonts.
  • Easy-to-use drag-and-drop editor.
  • Collaboration tools to work with a team.
lessons.task: Create a free Canva account and explore the main dashboard. Notice the different template categories available.

lessons.title: Navigating the Interface
lessons.content:
The Canva Dashboard

When you log in, you'll see the main dashboard. The top bar has the search function, where you can look for templates. The left-side panel gives you access to your projects, brand kits, and other tools. The main area showcases template suggestions.

The Editor Workspace

Once you select a template, you enter the editor. The left panel changes to show elements, text, uploads, and more. The top toolbar provides options for the selected element, like color, font size, and effects. The canvas in the middle is where you create your design.
lessons.task: Open any template (like an 'Instagram Post') and identify the main parts of the editor: the side panel, the top toolbar, and the canvas.

questions.question: What is the primary function of Canva?
questions.explanation: Canva is primarily known for its user-friendly, drag-and-drop interface that simplifies the design process.

questions.question: Where can you find templates for new designs on the Canva dashboard?
options: In the main search bar and suggestion area
In the footer of the page
questions.correctAnswer: In the main search bar and suggestion area
questions.explanation: The dashboard is designed to help you quickly find templates using the search bar or by browsing categories.

lessons.title: Working with Text and Fonts
lessons.content:
Adding and Editing Text

You can add text boxes from the 'Text' tab on the left panel. Canva offers heading, subheading, and body text presets, as well as creative font combinations. Once a text box is on your canvas, you can click to edit the content. The top toolbar allows you to change the font, size, color, alignment, spacing, and apply effects like shadows or curves.
lessons.task: Add a heading and a paragraph to a blank design. Experiment with changing the font and color of the heading.

lessons.title: Using Elements and Photos
lessons.content:
Shapes, Lines, and Graphics

The 'Elements' tab is your treasure chest for design assets. You can find everything from simple shapes and lines to complex illustrations and icons. Use the search bar within the Elements tab to find what you need.

Adding Photos

Canva has a massive library of free and Pro stock photos. You can find them under the 'Photos' tab or by searching in 'Elements'. You can also upload your own images via the 'Uploads' tab.
lessons.task: Search for a 'computer' icon in the Elements tab and add it to your design. Then, find a background photo and add it to the canvas.

questions.question: Which tab would you use to add a circle or a square to your design?
questions.explanation: The 'Elements' tab contains shapes, lines, graphics, photos, and more.

questions.question: What does the top toolbar in the Canva editor allow you to do?
options: Modify the selected element (e.g., change color or font)
questions.correctAnswer: Modify the selected element (e.g., change color or font)
questions.explanation: The top toolbar is contextual and shows editing options for the element you have currently selected on the canvas.
